name: python_starter
title: Python Starter
description: Get started with Python on your computer, learn how to install Python and create a simple programme

steps.title: Download and Install Python
steps.description: Download and install Python onto your computer

components.text: Open your prefered internet browser and go to https://www.python.org/downloads/
**Click** download Python 3
Confirm the download, if asked save the download on your Desktop
When the download finishes double click on the downloaded file
If any warning message appears about opening the file select `Run` or `Continue`
On a Windows computer **Tick Add Python 3.5 to PATH** then click 'Install Now'
On a Mac computer click 'Continue'
Follow the on screen instructions to install Python on your computer
On Windows **Press Windows + S** and type 'IDLE'
On Mac **Press cmd + S** and type 'IDLE'
Open IDLE and a 'Python Shell' window should appear
Did IDLE successfully open on your computer?

components.text: Make sure you have opened IDLE and you can see a 'Python Shell' window

steps.title: Creating Python files
steps.description: Python script can be written in a file so you can write more code and save your work

components.text: Make sure you have opened IDLE and you can see a 'Python Shell' window
Click `File -> New File` to create a new Python file
Type the following code into the new file
To run the file click `Run -> Run Module`
When you run a file it will ask if you want to save, **Click OK** to save the file

lines: **To stop Python asking you each time you save**

components.text: Choose where to save your file and call it `my_first_script.py`

hidden.text: When saving Python files only use **letters, numbers and underscrores** as the computer find spaces difficult

components.text: Did your script sucessfully run and pring out 'Hello Your Name Here'?
Now we can get the computer to ask what your name is, edit your code to look like the following
components.code:
myName = input('What is your name?')
print('Hello',myName)

components.text: Now run your code, on Windows **Press F5** on a Mac **Press fn + F5**
When your script runs **type your name** into the Python Shell then **press enter**
Does your script now greet you by the name you provide?
